name: Belleview Biltmore Hotel Golf, Beach and Spa Resort

reviews.title: Great Meetings - Great Stay - A great american find
reviews.text: What a classic! Usually when we have meetings there in the same old same old hotel types. This year we held our meeting in the Belleview Biltmore and it was grand.

First, unlike most American hotels, this hotel offerred large spaces to walk, mingle. No claustriphobia here. Mu room was ultra large - they call it a standard, the hilton calls this a suite. 12/14' ceilings, large bath and two walk-in closets!! For a business traveller this was fantastic
reviews.title: Historical Gem Deserves a Chance!

likes.liked: — The charming feel and friendly staff.

reviews.text: OVerall the hotel is just a marvel - a true Amercican Gem. Yes it is old, but it was built in 1890's. For America, that is almost 40% of our histroy. And the resort has losts of history. Recommend you take the historic tour.
reviews.title: beautiful

reviews.text: Our Meetings were all geat as we had a multiple rooms from a amphthetater for our trainging to a magnificant star light ball romm that for first time inour comapny, added real glamor to the dinners and awards -- ans the kitchern turned out just marvilous food.
reviews.title: Exciting Adventure

likes.liked: — The largeness of the hotel and the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not use the Spa, but several others did and seemed quite pleased. I did use the spa pool, played some golf and enjoyed a geat bar on the beach at sunset.
reviews.title: Great Old Hotel! Loved it!

likes.liked: — Large open spaces, homelike feel, uniqueness, large windows

reviews.text: I read all the reviews before I took my weekend get-away to the Belleview Biltmore. I took them all to heart and went! When we arrived, with our two small dogs, we had the friendliess staff helping us. Check-in took about 3 minutes and we were off to our room. Our room was spacious with high ceilings, a huge walk-in closet, and a spacious bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the overhead fan was a help when falling asleep.
reviews.title: Charming Victorian Hotel

likes.liked: — The unique and classic feel of the hotel
likes.disliked: — The prices on food were a little steep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is over 100 years old and its aroma lets you know that it has seen many days. I grew up in a house that was an antique, so the smell was more nostalgic than annoying.
reviews.title: A real DUMP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overall appearance of the hotel shows that it does need some topical work done to it, but to really appreciate this beauty is to look past it. All of the staff was attentive, the hotel is enormous so the strolls were inviting. Everything is right at your fingertips (an ice cream/coffee parlor, an Irish pub, a spa (with all the amenities), an old fashioned bar, dining room, tours (ghost tour given on Saturday evenings), meeting rooms, ball rooms, a small shop, and even a little museum about the hotel).
reviews.title: Fun time at the Belleview Biltmore

likes.disliked: — no pull chain on ceiling fan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had the opportunity to go back, I would. Just keep in mind that this is an "antique" hotel and to fix it up would take lots of time and money. They are well on their way. Just sit back and relax!
reviews.title: what a dump

reviews.text: I agree with the previous poster. Stayed there March 24, 2007, We were booked and paid for four nights, but left after the first, if it hadn't been late in the day we wouldn't have stayed at all. We had a non-refundable reservation and were will to absorb the loss, that is how terrible we found it. Very dusty, one of that bath tub taps was off, you had to hold it in place to get water, water backed up. Long hair on the floor(we both have short). Gaping holes in the wall where the plaster had fallen off. Only two electrical outlets in the room, one behind the bed that had a light extension cord connecting the lapms, and clock. the other had the desk lamp and tv plugged in to it. We had to have a light bulb replaced and were told that if we plugged a hair dryer in that it would probably blow a fuse. Floors were about three inches lower on one side than the other, our head was lower than the rest of our body. Atring attached to a chain was used to turn on one of the lights. There were a number of safety issues that concered us as well. Our window view was of rotting wood, a roof covered with a shredded tarp and windows covered up. this place needs major renovations. We are not snobs, just like a clean safe place to stay. I wrote to the general manager about my concerns, but they did not have the courtesy to acknowledge. I also followed up with a phone call that they did not return.
reviews.title: No charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Biltmore for one night, booked through Priceline. This old historical hotel is charming. I agree it needs renovation, but I understand the new owners have started with replacing the roof and have plans to bring it back to it's original glory. Our room was very small, but clean, with nice Aveda products. The grounds are well maintained and we enjoyed sitting on the swing at night just listening to the birds and crickets. It was so quiet, a welcome departure from the noise of our home city of Chicago. The staff was very helpful with no attitude. There is no beach , but a shuttle will take you to Sand Key to their Cabana Club, where you can swim and eat. We decided to drive ourselves and it took less than 15 minutes to get there. We sat upstairs on the patio for happy hour, had excellent grouper sandwiches and listened to live entertainment.
reviews.title: Would go back again

reviews.text: There is a guard at the front gate of the hotel, so you don't see any riff raff running around.
reviews.title: What a disaster!

likes.liked: — The best experience I had here was when we drove away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you love the generics of a Holiday Inn, Marriott or Hilton don't stay here. But as far as calling this a dump, I have to say no way.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: The real scoop on this hotel (completely objective opinion to consider)

likes.liked: — Good value; historic landmark; close to lots to do

reviews.text: After spending a week in Tampa on company business, I opted to spend the weekend in Clearwater at the Belleview Biltmore. My mom had flown in especially for our "Spa Weekend" and we had both been looking forward to it for some time. Driving down the entrance to the property, you can't help but be impressed. The grounds are manicured and quite beautiful.
reviews.title: DON'T GET MARRIED HERE!

likes.liked: — LACK OF CUSTOMER SRERVICE, BAD ATTITUDES, NOT PROFESSIONAL OR CARING

reviews.text: Was a little scared about going to this hotel after reading some reviews. It seems you either love it or you hate it.
reviews.title: Grand Ole Place

likes.disliked: — Little in wines at the Bar

reviews.text: Funny thing is we feel its a 3.5 out of 5.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Old Lady

reviews.text: Nice old place. It would look fabulous if it weren,t for the roof which appears to be under repair but never saw anyone there working on it. Albeit we were there over the long Easter weekend.
reviews.title: BEEN HERE AND DONE IT 4 TIMES-ALWAYS WORTH IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was friendly and attentive. Rooms were kept very clean. Bed was comfortable. Yes you can see some age when you look up at the 12 foot ceilngs, but all in all the place is clean and more importantly has unbelievable character. There is a mild woody or musty smell but its not overpowering and it really just adds to the ambiance.
reviews.title: Great getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good. Our plan included breakfast buffets which were very good which allowed us to fill up on and skip lunch.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, but service and food lacking

likes.liked: — The history and charm of the buildings

aka: Belleview Biltmore Hotel Golf, Beach Clearwater
description: This posh Victorian-style resort features an 18-hole championship golf course along with a world-famous golf school. As part of a planned $100 million dollar plus restoration and renovation the resort closed to the public on Monday June 1st. It is anticipated that "The White Queen of The Gulf" will reopen sometime in 2012.
